Interface com.chimu.dome.state.ReplicateState

public interface ReplicateState
ReplicateStates keep track of the current state of a domain object and know how to transition states based on method "triggers". ReplicateStates are an internal delegation object to the actual Replicate.

See Also:
StateToReplicateInterface, StatePack

Method Index

delete(StateToReplicateInterface)
isClean()
isDirty()
Is the state "dirty": will a save cause a write to the database
isNew()
markDirty(StateToReplicateInterface)
refresh(StateToReplicateInterface)
Refresh the replicate from the database
save(StateToReplicateInterface)
Save the changes (or deletion of) the replicate to the database.
willDelete()
Is this a state that will cause the object to be deleted on save?
